Run4YourBits

Class Background

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • Run4YourBits.Background
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Background
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.lang.Runnable
    This class is in charge of painting and managing the different types of obstacles as well as the character and its collisions
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Background

        public Background(int levelLength,
          int actualHeight,
          int maxHeightValue,
          java.lang.String characterImage,
          java.lang.String characterHitImage,
          java.lang.String characterGameOverImage,
          int characterSteps,
          int speed,
          int respawnPoint,
          java.lang.String backgroundImage,
          java.lang.String frameImage,
          java.lang.String lowObstacleImage,
          java.lang.String highObstacleImage,
          int obstacleDistance,
          int lowObstacleHeight,
          java.lang.String musicFile,
          java.lang.String jumpSound,
          java.lang.String hitSound,
          java.lang.String dashSound,
          int delta,
          java.awt.Color stringColor,
          boolean playMusic)
        This method creates a completely new level based on user input
        Parameters:
        levelLength - the length of the level in pixels (or screens if you go pixels/800)
        actualHeight - the height of the avatar that varies depending on the movements it makes
        maxHeightValue - the maximum height allowed for jumps
        characterImage - filename of the avatar that will be displayed
        characterHitImage - filename of the avatar image when hit
        characterGameOverImage - filename of the avatar image when dead
        characterSteps - number of frames the character image has
        speed - speed at which the character moves
        respawnPoint - starter point
        backgroundImage - filename of the background image
        frameImage - filename of the frame image
        lowObstacleImage - filename of the image for Low Obstacles
        highObstacleImage - filename of the image for High Obstacles
        obstacleDistance - minimum distance between obstacles
        lowObstacleHeight - y coordenate for Low Obstacles
        musicFile - filename of the background music
        jumpSound - filename of the jumping sound for that level
        hitSound - filename of the hitting sound for that level
        dashSound - filename of the ducking sound for that level
        stringColor - this defines the color of the highscore and the multiplier, the possible values are defined by java.awt.Color
        playMusic - to play or not to play the music, that is the question
        See Also:
        Character, Obstacle, HighObstacle, LowObstacle
